verses.verse: Can you draw out <WH4900> leviathan <WH3882> with a hook <WH2443>? or his tongue <WH3956> with a cord <WH2256> which you let down <WH8257>?
Can you put <WH7760> a hook <WH100> into his nose <WH639>? or bore <WH5344> his jaw <WH3895> through with a thorn <WH2336>?
Will he make many <WH7235> supplications <WH8469> unto you <WH1696>? will he speak soft words unto you <WH7390>?
Will he make <WH3772> a covenant <WH1285> with you <WH3947>? will you take him for a servant <WH5650> for ever <WH5769>?
Will you play <WH7832> with him as with a bird <WH6833>? or will you bind <WH7194> him for your maidens <WH5291>?
Shall the companions <WH2271> make a banquet <WH3739> of him <WH2673>? shall they part him among the merchants <WH3669>?
Can you fill <WH4390> his skin <WH5785> with barbed irons <WH7905>? or his head <WH7218> with fish <WH1709> spears <WH6767>?
Lay <WH7760> your hand <WH3709> upon him <WH2142>, remember the battle <WH4421>, do no more <WH3254>.
Behold <WH8431>, the hope of him is in vain <WH3576>: shall not one be cast down <WH2904> even at the sight of him <WH4758>?
None is so fierce <WH393> that dare stir him up <WH5782>: who then is able to stand <WH3320> before me <WH6440>?
Who has given <WH6923> to me <WH7999>, that I should repay him <WH8064>? whatever is under the whole heaven is mine.
I will not conceal <WH2790> his parts <WH907>, nor his power <WH1369>, nor his comely <WH2433> proportion <WH6187>.
Who can discover <WH1540> the face <WH6440> of his garment <WH3830>? or who can come <WH935> to him with his double <WH3718> bridle <WH7448>?
Who can open <WH6605> the doors <WH1817> of his face <WH6440>? his teeth <WH8127> are terrible <WH367> round about <WH5439>.
His scales <WH4043> are his pride <WH1346>, shut up together <WH5462> as with a close <WH6862> seal <WH2368>.
One <WH259> is so near <WH5066> to another <WH259>, that no air <WH7307> can come between them <WH935>.
They are joined <WH1692> one <WH376> to another <WH251>, they stick together <WH3920>, that they cannot be sundered <WH6504>.
By his sneezings <WH5846> a light <WH216> does shine <WH1984>, and his eyes <WH5869> are like the eyelids <WH6079> of the morning <WH7837>.
Out of his mouth <WH6310> go <WH1980> burning torches <WH3940>, and sparks <WH3590> of fire <WH784> leap out <WH4422>.
Out of his nostrils <WH5156> goes <WH3318> smoke <WH6227>, as out of a seething <WH5301> pot <WH1731> or caldron <WH100>.
His breath <WH5315> kindles <WH3857> coals <WH1513>, and a flame <WH3851> goes out <WH3318> of his mouth <WH6310>.
In his neck <WH6677> remains <WH3885> strength <WH5797>, and sorrow <WH1670> is turned into joy <WH1750> before him <WH6440>.
The flakes <WH4651> of his flesh <WH1320> are joined together <WH1692>: they are firm <WH3332> in themselves <WH4131>; they cannot be moved.
His heart <WH3820> is as firm <WH3332> as a stone <WH68>; Yes <WH3332>, as hard as a piece <WH6400> of the nether millstone <WH8482>.
When he raises up <WH7613> himself <WH352>, the mighty are afraid <WH1481>: by reason of breakings <WH7667> they purify themselves <WH2398>.
The sword <WH2719> of him that lays <WH5381> at him cannot hold <WH6965>: the spear <WH2595>, the dart <WH4551>, nor the coat of mail <WH8302>.
He esteems <WH2803> iron <WH1270> as straw <WH8401>, and brass <WH5154> as rotten <WH7539> wood <WH6086>.
The arrow <WH1121> cannot make him flee <WH1272>: slingstones <WH68> are turned <WH2015> with him into stubble <WH7179>.
Darts <WH8455> are counted <WH2803> as stubble <WH7179>: he laughs <WH7832> at the shaking <WH7494> of a spear <WH3591>.
Sharp <WH2303> stones <WH2789> are under him <WH7502>: he spreads sharp pointed things <WH2742> upon the mire <WH2916>.
He makes the deep <WH4688> to boil <WH7570> like a pot <WH5518>: he makes <WH7760> the sea <WH3220> like a pot of ointment <WH4841>.
He makes a path <WH5410> to shine <WH215> after <WH310> him <WH2803>; one would think the deep <WH8415> to be hoary <WH7872>.
Upon earth <WH6083> there is not his like <WH4915>, who is made <WH6213> without <WH1097> fear <WH2844>.
He beholds <WH7200> all high <WH1364> things <WH4428>: he is a king over all the sons <WH1121> of pride <WH7830>.
